intro: Clavija caliensis, commonly known as the Caliensi Clavija, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Due to habitat loss, Clavija caliensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
